name: Turning Point
description: Children's Crisis Stabilization Unit (CCSU) providing 24/7 crisis intervention and stabilization services for children ages 2-17 who are experiencing mental health, substance use, or suicide crises. Services include behavioral health treatment, substance use treatment, and crisis intervention to prevent hospitalization or removal from home. Children remain at the unit until stabilized, typically 3-7 days, with comprehensive community resource coordination for families.
source: Verified from official Cumberland River Behavioral Health website and multiple third-party directories
hours_of_operation: 24 hours a day, 7 days a week
eligibility_requirements: Children ages 2-17 years who are in crisis and/or at high risk for hospitalization or removal from home during a crisis situation
populations_served: Children and adolescents ages 2-17 experiencing mental health, substance use, or suicide crises
cost_information: Payment based on ability to pay; services are confidential and sensitive to cultural needs
languages_available: English, ASL interpreter services available for Deaf and Hard of Hearing individuals
